channel.title: Unpartition a HD
channel.description: Well, I'm buying a new HD, and want to keep my old one. But for some reason it was partitioned into a C: and a D: drive. For some reason I can't install games to the D: drive. It says that it will make the HD unstable or something like that. So I only have like 40GB to install games on. So is there a way that I can get rid of the D: partition, without losing any files? So my C: will get the total 80 GB :o.

item.title: Unpartition a HD
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:3, topic:157969”][quote author=therealjdb link=topic=215338.msg1877994#msg1877994 date=1194647287]
You would need to get a 3rd party partition application but you would lose your data so you would need to backup anything you wanted.
[/quote]

You would only lose what you had on the D: drive, if at all.[/quote]
That’s what I meant lol, thanks for clarifying

Read full topic
